### Government Tender Announcement
#### Title
High Commission of Canada in South Africa - Design and Installation of a Microgrid System
#### Announcement Reference
cb-224-29396487

#### Overview
The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) invites qualified Design/Builders to submit proposals for the design, installation, and commissioning of a microgrid system at the High Commission of Canada in South Africa. The selected bidder will be responsible for providing engineering design, construction, testing, and commissioning services for the system, which will include photovoltaic solar panels (PV).

#### Tender Details

* **Solicitation Number**: 24-250214
* **Publication Date**: 2023-09-28
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-11-02 (Expired)
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: 2023-11-06
* **Expected Contract End Date**: 2024-06-15
* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD)
* **Contact Information**: Meagan Leclair, realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca, (343) 598-9721

#### Documents

* The official Tender Notice can be found on the Government of Canada's tendering website, [Canadabuys](https://canadabuys.canada.ca).
* All supporting documents, including the RFP and addenda, can be accessed on the Canadabuys website under the Tender Notice for solicitation number 24-250214.

#### Technical Specifications

* The successful bidder must demonstrate a thorough understanding of microgrid technologies, including design, installation, and commissioning.
* The bidder must also provide evidence of their ability to meet the project deadlines and requirements.

#### Evaluation Criteria

* The selection criteria include the bidder's combined rating of technical merit and price.

#### Procurement Method

* This tender is conducted under the Competitive - Open Bidding method.

#### Trade Agreements

* The contract is governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

#### Regions of Opportunity

* The project is based in South Africa, and the bidder must be prepared to work on-site internationally.
